title: Akash Prime successfully tested in Ladakh by Indian Army
content: Akash Prime is an upgraded version of the Akash system, equipped with an indigenous active Radio Frequency (RF) seeker for enhanced precision irrespective of weather and terrain.

title: Two tribals killed, 19 injured as mini goods carrier topples near Aliyar in Coimbatore
content: The police said that the accident occurred around 8.15 a.m. when the vehicle carrying 20 persons from Navamalai — 15 men and five women — approached Chinnarpathi on the Pollachi-Valparai Road

title: Senior Maoist couple surrenders before Telangana’s Rachakonda Police after 45 years underground
content: The couple expressed their desire to live peacefully with their families and give up the armed movement they were part of for over four decades

title: Rahul Gandhi slams Election Commission over Bihar Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls
content: Opposition parties have asserted that the ongoing exercise will disfranchise crores of eligible Indian citizens for the want of citizenship documents.

title: Monsoon continues to disrupt life across Himachal Pradesh; claims 109 lives in nearly one month
content: Of these, 64 people lost their lives in rain-related incidents, while 45 died in road accidents, underlining the extensive human toll of this year's monsoon fury, as per a State report

title: One killed, several injured in clash between evicted people, security forces in Assam
content: He said forest guards and police personnel were attacked by alleged encroachers with sticks when they had gone to cordon off a part of the Paikan reserve forest, where an eviction drive was carried out on Saturday.

title: CBI facilitated return of 134 fugitives from abroad in past 5 years: officials
content: The process of extradition has three stages: issuance of a Red Notice by Interpol, geolocation of the fugitive, and third, extradition after legal and diplomatic manoeuvres, all of which are time-consuming processes.

title: Electrocution of school student: Kerala government orders inquiry
content: Minister Sivankutty says Director of General Education has been dispatched to accident site in Kollam to investigate the episode and give a detailed report

title: Student dies after coming into contact with live wire at school in Kerala’s Kollam
content: According to reports, 13-year-old was electrocuted while trying to retrieve a slipper that had fallen onto the roof of bicycle shed

title: Kavitha demands Telangana CM’s resignation over Banakacherla project
content: If Revanth Reddy does not lead an all-party delegation to Delhi during the upcoming Parliament sessions, Jagruti will go to Delhi and fight on behalf of Telangana, warned Kavitha

title: Trust moves Madras High Court against party flag of Vijay’s TVK
content: Thondai Mandala Saandror Dharma Paribalana Sabai, a trust based in Chennai, claims that the TVK flag is “deceptively” similar to its registered trademark

title: Prisoner admitted in private hospital shot dead in Patna
content: According to the police, the deceased was identified as Chandan Mishra, a resident of Buxar district and he was a dreaded criminal and imprisoned in Beur Jail in connection with a murder case.

title: Midnight makeovers and million-dollar coats: inside Hyderabad’s hub of aviation artistry
content: Tucked away in a hangar on the edge of the airport, GMR Aero Technic is doing more than just routine maintenance; it’s redefining what aircraft transformation looks like, one flawless coat at a time.

title: Justice Sanjeev Sachdeva sworn in as Chief Justice of Madhya Pradesh High Court
content: Madhya Pradesh Governor Mangubhai Patel administered the oath of office to Justice Sanjeev Sachdeva at a function in the Raj Bhawan in Bhopal.

title: In a first, State-run bus service starts in Maoist-hit Maharashtra village
content: The bus service from the remote Markanar village to Aheri has been started for the first time since independence, and it is set to benefit nearly 1,200 residents

title: Cyberabad records first property attachment under BNSS in multi-crore fraud case
content: The case pertains to an employee of a private company who in collusion with other accused manipulated invoices and freight charges to siphon off large sums of money

title: Court orders to file case against P.C. George over hate speech
content: Mr. George alleged that those belonging to a particular community were nurturing a generation that believed that others had no right to live

title: Odisha bandh: Normal life partially hit as Congress, other parties observe bandh to condemn Balasore student death
content: The Home Department has directed all district collectors and SPs to remain on high alert in view of the road blockades, picketings, agitations, and also cautioned them against violence during the 12-hour bandh.

title: Fire mishap at Durodine Industries in Hyderabad; no casualties or injuries reported
content: An investigation is under way to determine the cause of the fire and assess the full extent of the damage

title: Congress demands scraping of digital attendance system for MNREGA workers
content: Recently the government in a direction to the States flagged the various ways National Mobile Monitoring System (NMMS) used to digitally capture attendance of workers is being manipulated

title: Nimisha Priya execution: Won’t grant pardon, says family of Yemeni victim
content: Social media posts purportedly by Talal’s brother Abdul Fatah Mahdi indicated the family’s resolute stance on retribution as per Islamic law rather than accepting blood money and pardon Nimisha Priya

title: Enforcement Directorate raids premises in U.P., Mumbai linked to Chhangur Baba amid religious conversion ‘racket’ allegations
content: The federal probe agency recently filed a case to probe the activities and financial details of Jalaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, alleged to be a mastermind of an illegal religious conversion racket operating in Uttar Pradesh

title: Some cities in the northwestern, northern Indo-Gangetic Plain shielded from long-range aerosol pollution
content: Researchers refer to the cities that show relatively lower aerosol levels compared with the surrounding areas as Urban Aerosol Clean Islands

title: Nitish Kumar announces free electricity up to 125 units in poll-bound Bihar
content: Bihar CM said the government has also decided to install solar power plants on the rooftops or in the nearby public places of domestic consumers in the next three years

title: Amarnath Yatra suspended from Jammu due to bad weather
content: The yatra was suspended from both Pahalgam and Baltal base camps following heavy rains and landslides

title: Kudumbashree’s ‘Jana Galsa’ to give tribal art forms a new lease of life
content: Project will transform tribal art forms into viable enterprises that can generate employment and income for the indigenous people

title: Jagan acting like a destructive force, says TDP MLA Nakka Ananda Babu
content: It was Jagan Mohan Reddy who had governed the State in an authoritarian manner for five years, registered false cases against thousands and empowered the police system to achieve his personal vendetta against the opposition leaders, he alleges

title: Two shootings in 12 hours: Multiple teams deployed to trace absconding suspects
content: The attackers, believed to be four to five in number, have been identified and are currently on the run

title: West Bengal once again, without explanation, delays UG admission to colleges run and aided by it
content: Lakhs of students applying for these colleges staring at uncertainty while private/autonomous institutions are set to begin classes shortly

title: Bengaluru stampede: Karnataka govt blames RCB for crowd surge; cites Virat Kohli video
content: The Karnataka government has blamed Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) management for a deadly stampede outside M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on June 4, which resulted in 11 fatalities. According to a report submitted to the High Court, RCB, along with DNA Networks and KSCA, organized a victory celebration without consulting the police or obtaining necessary permissions.

title: Violence during Assam eviction drive: Settlers clash with police-forest team; 1 dead
content: In Goalpara district, Assam, a joint police and forest force team faced a violent clash with evicted settlers in the Paikan reserve forest, resulting in at least one fatality. The authorities were conducting an eviction drive, continuing from last Saturday when 140 hectares of forest land were cleared, impacting hundreds of houses and religious structures built by Bengal-origin migrant Muslims.

title: Bihar SIR: Rahul Gandhi repeats voter theft charge; asks if EC is now BJP's 'election chori' branch
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of acting as an "election theft wing" for the BJP in the upcoming Bihar elections. He shared a video alleging voter fraud by government officials. Gandhi questioned the EC's neutrality, referring to past concerns raised about the Maharashtra election results.

title: Watch: Amarnath pilgrims washed downhill - yatra suspended
content: Amarnath Yatra was halted on Thursday following a fatal landslide along the Baltal route in Ganderbal, resulting in one death and three injuries. The suspension follows 36 hours of continuous rain in the valley. Authorities have issued a weather advisory, forecasting more heavy rainfall across Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praises China’s AI: Calls models 'World Class', even one banned by US
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praised Chinese AI models as "world class" at a Beijing expo, highlighting their open-source approach and global impact. This endorsement comes as Nvidia resumes H20 chip sales to China, signaling an easing of trade tensions.

title: 29 missing in Mandi & Kullu presumed dead; search called off
content: Following devastating flash floods and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh, authorities presume 29 missing individuals dead across Mandi and Kullu districts. Search and rescue operations are winding down as NDRF teams withdraw, having recovered 15 bodies but finding no trace of the others.

title: 2 men found murdered in MP forest, throats slit
content: In a tragic incident in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district, two young brothers, aged 9 and 6, were kidnapped and brutally murdered. Their bodies were discovered in a forest, concealed with stones, approximately 13km from their home.

title: Who are Druze? Sect caught in crossfire as Syria-Israel tensions escalates
content: Deadly sectarian violence between Druze militias and Bedouin fighters in southern Syria has escalated tensions, prompting Israeli intervention. Israel, citing a commitment to protect the Druze minority, launched airstrikes after Syrian forces intervened to restore control in Suwayda. The Druze community faces challenges with Syria's new government regarding disarmament and representation, leading to ongoing conflict and a fragile ceasefire agreement.

title: Remake of the world's costliest divorce: Rivian CEO’s divorce hits voting power
content: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe's divorce settlement mirrors Jeff Bezos' situation, impacting his control over the electric vehicle company. Scaringe transferred shares and options worth approximately $130 million to his ex-wife, Meagan, reducing his voting power from 7.6% to around 4%, the lowest since Rivian's IPO.

title: Nuh horror: 17-year-old girl maimed with liquor bottle for protesting rash driving
content: In Nuh, a 17-year-old girl was attacked by two men on a bike after she confronted them about their rash driving. The accused smashed a liquor bottle on her head, causing serious injuries and loss of teeth. While locals noted the bike's number, police registered an FIR three days later, prompting criticism from a Congress MP.

title: Kanwar Yatra: Ghaziabad shuts schools, educational institutions till July 23
content: In Ghaziabad, schools will remain closed from Thursday until July 23 due to the Kanwar Yatra, sparking criticism from teachers and parents concerned about academic disruption. While some private schools plan online classes, others question feasibility for all students, especially those from EWS backgrounds.

title: Photos: Shami shares emotional birthday post for daughter - read
content: Indian cricketer Mohammed Shami celebrated his daughter Aaira's 10th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post amidst ongoing legal disputes with estranged wife Hasin Jahan. In the case, the Calcutta High Court had recently ordered Shami to pay Rs 1.5 lakh monthly to Jahan and Rs 2.5 lakh to Aaira for maintenance.

title: Anand Mahindra's message to Elon Musk on Tesla India launch: Meet you at ...
content: Anand Mahindra welcomed Elon Musk and Tesla to India as the EV company officially debuted with its first showroom, the Tesla Experience Centre, in Mumbai. Mahindra expressed optimism and acknowledged the competition Tesla brings to India's growing EV sector. Tesla has launched its Model Y in India, with prices starting at Rs 61 lakh.

title: Kids wave tricolour as bus reaches Maoist HQ Abujmarh
content: In a significant victory against Maoist influence, a state-run bus reached Maraknar, a remote tribal village formerly within a Maoist-controlled zone. This marks a turning point after 78 years, connecting residents to essential services and ending their isolation.

title: Compelling dead marriage to go on perpetuates mental agony: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that courts can grant divorce when a marriage is irretrievably broken, ending a 16-year matrimonial dispute. Justices Nath and Mehta invoked Article 142, emphasizing that forcing couples to stay in 'dead marriages' causes mental agony.

title: Shaquille O’Neal threatens to punch Robert Griffin III over Angel Reese
content: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal has issued a stern warning to former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III over his negative comments and a racist social media post targeting WNBA player Angel Reese. O'Neal, angered by Griffin's actions, particularly the reposting of a derogatory image, threatened physical violence if Griffin continues his behavior.

title: Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce support dad Scott Swift after heart surgery
content: Taylor Swift prioritized her family as her father, Scott Swift, underwent a quintuple bypass surgery last month. She paused her Eras Tour obligations to be with him, along with her mother, Andrea, and brother, Austin. Travis Kelce, her boyfriend, offered his support during this challenging time, as the family focused on Scott's recovery following the procedure.

title: NBA trade rumors: Heat eye $49M Lakers superstar as LeBron future uncertain
content: Speculation intensifies as rumors swirl around Luka Doncic potentially joining the Miami Heat, while LeBron James' future with the Lakers remains uncertain. Doncic's contract negotiations are reportedly tense, and Miami is poised to make a move if he seeks an exit. The possibility of LeBron returning to Miami adds another layer to this captivating offseason narrative.

title: India-US trade deal: India open to GM farm imports? Mini deal in works
content: India-US trade deal: India and the US are in trade deal negotiations, with India seemingly open to importing some genetically modified agriculture products for animal feed, but not GM corn and soybeans.

title: Language row: Shopkeeper assaulted over ‘anti-Marathi’ WhatsApp status
content: In Mumbai's Vikhroli, a shopkeeper faced assault by MNS members over an allegedly 'anti-Marathi' WhatsApp status. Confronted outside his shop, he was physically attacked and forced to publicly apologize. A video shows him holding his ears and begging for forgiveness, while MNS workers warned against disrespecting Marathi culture. Police are yet to confirm if a complaint has been filed.

title: 'Sniper unit fired upon convoy': 27 Pak troops killed in attacks by Baloch fighters
content: Baloch insurgent groups have claimed responsibility for multiple deadly attacks on Pakistani military forces in Balochistan over the past two days. The Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) stated its Fateh Squad targeted a military transport bus in Kalat, reportedly killing 27 troops. The Balochistan Liberation Front (BLF) also announced separate operations, including IED blasts and ambushes, resulting in further casualties.

title: 'Assigning blame before ...' : Pilots' body raises red flag over Air India 171 crash report
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has voiced strong concerns regarding the preliminary report on the Air India Flight AI171 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 240 people. FIP criticized the exclusion of pilot representatives from the investigation and the report's reliance on selectively interpreted cockpit recordings.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence: Cryptic tweet after Azealia Banks leak
content: Azealia Banks ignited a social media storm by claiming Conor McGregor, celebrating his birthday in Italy, sent her nude photos. Instead of directly addressing the allegations, McGregor responded to a fan's joke with a political comment about Irish politics. Banks further alleged a long history of nude exchanges and harassment, while McGregor continued posting from his yacht, seemingly unfazed.

title: Indian woman caught shoplifting: US embassy reacts after viral video; issues warning
content: Following the arrest of an Indian tourist in the US for alleged shoplifting, the US Embassy in India issued a stern warning. Visa holders risk revocation and a permanent ban for breaking American laws, including theft and assault. Immigration lawyer Alen Takhsh highlighted the severe consequences, even without a conviction, potentially leading to deportation.

title: JEE Advanced 2025 scorecard out: Official link out - Details
content: The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kanpur has released the JEE Advanced 2025 scorecards on jeeadv.ac.in. Candidates can download their results using registration number and date of birth. The exam was held for admission to undergraduate engineering courses at 23 IITs. Qualified students are now participating in JoSAA counselling for seat allocation.

title: 9-year-old girl dies of suspected heart attack; fainted while having lunch at school
content: In a tragic incident, nine-year-old Prachi Kumawat, a Class 4 student in Sikar district, passed away at school due to a suspected heart attack. During lunch break, she collapsed while opening her tiffin box. Despite immediate medical attention and CPR at a local hospital, she was referred to a larger hospital in Sikar, but was declared dead on arrival.

title: Prisoner on parole attacked at Patna hospital by rival gang during treatment
content: A parolee, Chandan Mishra, facing murder charges, was attacked by a rival gang at a Patna hospital while receiving treatment. Patna police are collaborating with Buxar police to identify the shooters, possessing their photographs. This incident adds to a series of shootings in Bihar, intensifying criticism of the state government's law and order management ahead of upcoming elections.

title: Gold smuggling case twist: No bail to Ranya Rao for 1 year
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao faces a year in jail for gold smuggling, following an order from the COFEPOSA Advisory Board, which also denied her bail. Arrested at Bengaluru airport with 14.8 kg of gold worth Rs 12.56 crore smuggled from Dubai, Ranya's earlier bail pleas were rejected.

title: 10-year-old girl returning home from school sexually assaulted in Tamil Nadu
content: A shocking incident occurred near Gummidipoondi. A 10-year-old girl was abducted and sexually assaulted. The girl was returning home from school. An unidentified man committed this heinous crime. The girl bravely raised an alarm. This forced the perpetrator to flee. Police have registered a case under the Pocso Act. Special teams are searching for the suspect.

title: Gold & silver prediction: Yellow metal might hit Rs 1 lakh soon - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to rise, potentially reaching ₹99,800, driven by technical indicators and favorable fundamentals like easing Fed rate pressure. Silver has seen a rally, supported by industrial demand and macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: 'Not afraid of war': Syria slams Israel's 'wide-scale targeting' of civilians - Key details
content: Syria's interim President Ahmed al-Sharaa pledged accountability for those who harmed the Druze population, following Israeli airstrikes in Damascus targeting military and government sites. He reassured Druze citizens, rejecting external interference and transferring security responsibilities to local leaders. Al-Sharaa affirmed the Syrian people's readiness to defend their dignity, prioritizing national interests over conflict.

title: R. Madhavan's weight loss: Simple lifestyle changes for effective results
content: R. Madhavan, known for his versatile acting, surprised fans with his weight loss journey in 2024. He revealed losing weight in just 21 days by adopting a simple, consistent lifestyle. This included intermittent fasting, chewing food thoroughly, early morning walks, screen detox before sleep, and a diet rich in green vegetables and easily metabolizable foods, while avoiding processed items.

title: 2025 ESPY Awards: 5 Best-dressed stars who dominated the red carpet
content: The 2025 ESPY Awards in Los Angeles saw athletes shine both in accomplishment and style. Suni Lee's gold gown set the tone, while Lindsey Vonn and Ilona Maher impressed with daring looks. Simone Biles and Jonathan Owens coordinated in stunning fashion, and Jordan Chiles brought elegance in a woven gown.

title: Travel diary: Manchester's 'other' Old Trafford getting ready for fourth India vs England Test
content: In Manchester, navigating to Old Trafford reveals a charming mix-up between the cricket and football stadiums. Locals, signage, and even security guards often point to the football ground first. But with the India-England Test set to take place on July 23, attention will soon shift to the "other" Old Trafford as preparations ramp up for its biggest game of the season.

title: Chinese restaurant under fire for offering lion cub cuddles
content: A Chinese restaurant is facing severe criticism for offering customers the chance to cuddle lion cubs during afternoon tea. Animal welfare groups are condemning the practice as exploitative and potentially dangerous, highlighting ethical concerns and the risk of injury. Despite the backlash, the restaurant defends its actions, claiming the cubs are well-cared for.

title: Delhi cops say 12-year-old behind bomb hoax
content: Delhi schools faced a third consecutive day of bomb threats via email, causing widespread panic and evacuations. Authorities traced Tuesday's threats to a 12-year-old student who confessed to sending them as a prank. Despite thorough searches revealing no explosives, multiple schools, including St. Thomas and Vasant Valley, received alarming emails.

title: Trade war: Trump plans 10–15% tariffs for over 150 countries; deal with India 'very close'
content: Donald Trump announced that the U.S. is nearing a trade agreement with India and seeing positive progress with the EU, while a deal with Canada remains uncertain. He also floated the idea of imposing tariffs on smaller nations. These discussions occur as the U.S. seeks improved trade terms before an August 1 deadline for tariff increases on most U.S. imports.

title: Snake rescuer dies after flaunting cobra on neck for 'reel'
content: Deepak Mahawar, a 42-year-old snake rescuer in Madhya Pradesh, tragically died after a cobra he rescued bit him. He had been posing with the snake around his neck for a social media video near his son's school. Although initially treated and showing signs of recovery, his condition worsened, leading to his death within 12 hours of the bite.

title: Astronomers capture birth of planets around a baby sun
content: Astronomers have spotted the earliest stages of rocky planet formation around a young, sun-like star named HOPS-315. Using the Webb Space Telescope and ESO's Alma telescope, scientists detected solid specks condensing within the gas disk, revealing silicon monoxide gas and crystalline silicate minerals. This unprecedented glimpse into "time zero" suggests planet formation could be a common process.

title: Quintuple bypass: Explaining the surgery Taylor Swift’s father underwent
content: Scott Swift, Taylor Swift's father, is recovering well after undergoing a quintuple bypass surgery last month due to a routine check-up revealing a serious heart condition. The surgery addressed coronary artery disease, a common issue caused by plaque buildup restricting blood flow. His family has been supporting him throughout his recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens on a flat note; BSE Sensex near 82,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, started Thursday’s trading session on a flat note. While Nifty50 was near 25,200, BSE Sensex was around 82,600.

title: 'Won't keep a rupee': Co-star on Radhika Yadav music video; denies ‘fame chase’ claims
content: Inam-ul-Haq, Radhika Yadav's co-star in 'Karwaan', pledges to donate all earnings from the music video. This decision follows the tragic death of Radhika, who was allegedly killed by her father. Inam denies any personal relationship with Radhika. He also rejects any communal angle to the incident. He is ready to cooperate with the police investigation.

title: Ahead of Bihar polls Nitish announces key scheme: Free electricity upto 125 units
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has announced free electricity for domestic consumers, up to 125 units, starting August 1, 2025. Kumar highlighted his government's focus on affordability, stating that this initiative will benefit approximately 1 crore 67 lakh families across the state. This announcement comes as the state gears up for elections in late 2025.

title: Explained: Federal Prosecutor Comey fired - was it for 'botching' Epstein-Maxwell & Diddy cases?
content: Maurene Comey, known for her involvement in the Ghislaine Maxwell and Sean "Diddy" Combs cases, was fired by the Trump administration, raising concerns about political interference. The dismissal follows other departures at SDNY and renewed scrutiny of Epstein files. Critics suggest her family connection to James Comey and the Combs trial outcome contributed to her removal, potentially impacting prosecutorial independence.

title: Probe Agency ED Raids 14 Places In Chhangur Baba Conversion Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday launched a massive search operation in connection with the Chhangur Baba religious conversion case at 14 different locations, including 12 premises in UP and 2 in Mumbai.

title: World's Tallest Hotel Is Set To Debut In Dubai. Here's What To Know
content: The UK-born modern Asian concept is opening a three-storey restaurant, bar, and pool area in the Ciel Tower.

title: New Air India Crash Details As US Media Accesses Last Pilot Conversation
content: The two pilots involved were Captain Sumeet Sabharwal and First Officer Clive Kunder, who had total flying experience of 15,638 hours and 3,403 hours.

title: Why Drones, AI Still Struggle To Find Missing Flood Victims Quickly
content: Recent successes in applying computer vision and machine learning to drone imagery for rapidly determining building and road damage after hurricanes or shifting wildfire lines suggest that AI could be valuable in searching for missing persons.

title: 7 Die As Their Car Collides With Motorcycle In Nashik, Bikers Injured
content: Seven people, including three women, three men, and a two-year-old child, were killed in a road accident in Maharashtra's Nashik on Wednesday when their car collided with a motorcycle. The two individuals on the motorcycle sustained serious injuries.

title: Who Are Druze And Why Israel Is Bombing Syria To Protect Them
content: The Israeli strikes targeted a compound housing Syria's Ministry of Defence and areas near the presidential palace in central Damascus, as well as military positions in Suwayda province.

title: Who Is Maurene Comey, Prosecutor In Jeffery Epstein And Sean 'Diddy' Combs Cases, Fired From Job
content: Maurene Comey's removal may be linked to her father, former FBI Director James Comey, who is under investigation, along with former CIA Director John Brennan, for possible false statements to Congress.

title: 10 Lakh Indians To Receive Free AI Training, Focus On Village Entrepreneurs
content: At least 10 lakh citizens will receive free training in artificial intelligence (AI) thanks to Common Service Centres, which falls under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

title: Raj Thackeray's Men Do It Again. Rajasthan Man Assaulted Over WhatsApp Status
content: Raj Thackeray's men have done it again. A shopkeeper in Mumbai's Vikhroli was assaulted by workers of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) over a WhatsApp status deemed offensive to the Marathi-speaking community.

title: 10-Year Elaborate Plan To Conserve Shivaji Forts Granted Heritage Tag
content: Conservation of the 12 forts associated with Shivaji Maharaj, which have been declared UNESCO World Heritage sites, will involve a comprehensive 10-year plan focusing on retaining historical characteristics, managing garbage, and deploying manpower.

title: Indian-Canadian Gangster Arrested In US For Running Global Drug Operation
content: An Indian-Canadian gangster has been arrested in the US for running a transnational drug operation along with a notorious Irish gang, local media here reported.

title: 7 Killed, 2 Injured In Car-Bike Collision In Nashik
content: Seven persons were killed and two others seriously injured after a car collided with a motorcycle in Maharashtra's Nashik district, police said on Thursday.

title: President Murmu To Present Swachh Survekshan Cleanliness Awards Today
content: President Droupadi Murmu will confer the prestigious Swachh Survekshan 2024-25 Awards for urban cleanliness during a national ceremony organised by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi, on Thursday.

title: 40 Fractures, Blunt Trauma: Indore Man Dies After Mob Assault Over Theft
content: Umendra Singh Thakur, 28, died after being allegedly brutally beaten by a group of labourers and guards associated with a bridge construction company. The attackers accused him of stealing iron rods - a suspicion that turned into a fatal assault.

title: Woman Dies After Giving Birth At Bihar Hospital, Family Alleges Negligence
content: A woman died in a private hospital in Bihar's Siwan after giving birth to twins. The family has claimed that the woman passed away due to alleged negligence by the hospital authorities and said that the doctors ran away.

title: 3.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Haryana's Rohtak, 4th Tremor In 8 Days
content: An earthquake measuring 3.3 on the Richter scale struck Rohtak in Haryana early Thursday, according to the National Centre for Seismology (NCS).

title: 85 Rescued By Visakhapatnam Cops After Crackdown On Human Trafficking Racket
content: Visakhapatnam Police has rescued 85 individuals and arrested 22 in a major crackdown on human trafficking and cybercrime operations, Dr. Shankabrata Bagchi, Visakhapatnam Police Commissioner announced on Wednesday.

title: Nitish Kumar asks education department to speed up recruitment of teachers
content: Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) termed the announcement of Chief Minister as a mere election slogan and it will get stuck in the model code of conduct (MCC).

title: 41,193 children rescued, 4960 missing women traced under Operation Muskan: CM Fadnavis
content: The issue of missing women was raised in the assembly after Shiv Sena (UBT) MLC Sunil Shinde asked for the status of the proposal to ‘Track missing women’.

title: Tripura CM claims incumbent BJP-led coalition government provided nearly 20,000 regular jobs
content: Dr Manik Saha advised youths to take advantage of entrepreneurship engagements and not to wait only for government jobs

title: Bihar government set up cell to maintain data bank of Supari killers
content: The Bihar Police also suspended a station house officer (SHO) for dereliction of duty in connection with the murder of Patna based industrialist Gopal Khemka.

title: Naidu releases report of Task Force on Economic Development for Swarna Andhra Pradesh
content: The expert panel has made a host of recommendations to the government on diverse sectors that have the potential to catapult it to the league of progressive States

title: Gujarat launches India’s first tribal genome project to tackle inherited diseases
content: The Tribal Genome Sequencing Project is an initiative by the government to sequence the genomes of 2,000 people belonging to tribal communities across 17 districts in the State

title: A.P. and Telangana resolve key river water issues in New Delhi meeting
content: Both States agree to share data reservoirs and preserve Srisailam project;  KRMB will be headquartered in Amaravati, while GRMB will remain in Hyderabad

title: NHRC issues notice to Delhi and UP government over drowning of two kids in public places
content: Observing that the incidents raise serious issues of violation of human rights of the victims, the commission had issued notice calling for a detailed report on the matter within two weeks.

title: Calcutta High Court dismisses teachers’ petitions against new SSC recruitment rules
content: ‘Untainted’ teachers say they are losing faith in the judicial system to offer them justice and said they are being criminalised for corruption done by government authorities

title: BJP government in Uttarakhand promoting VIP culture: Congress
content: The party questions how the BKTC chairman was allowed to fly to Kedarnath by a chopper despite suspension of service

title: Four arrested for misappropriating CMRF funds worth ₹8.71 lakh using forged cheques
content: The accused are alleged to have forged documents and siphoned off government funds intended for financially distressed applicants

title: Hyderabad’s Bolarum saw highest ozone pollution this summer, says study
content: Between March 1 and May 31, Bolarum recorded 17 days when ground-level ozone levels breached the safe limit — the highest in the city

title: Three held in CBI drive against mule account network across seven States
content: As part of ‘Operation Chakra-V,’ the agency searched multiple locations in Delhi, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Kerala, Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, and Rajasthan.

title: J&K making rapid strides on path of peace and prosperity: L-G Manoj Sinha
content: Delivering a lecture at Gandhi Smriti in the national capital, the Lieutenant-Governor says Jammu and Kashmir’s economy had more than doubled over the past five years

title: Agreement for biogas plant in Kozhikode to be signed soon
content: The Corporation will hand over seven acres for the facility, where 150 tonnes of biowaste will be processed

title: No exemption from selection of minor courses this year, says CU Registrar
content: Students pursuing major (main) courses with minors under the four-year undergraduate programme in affiliated colleges must choose all minors from two groups offered by a discipline other than their major, says a circular issued on July 14

title: Kodenchery panchayat to launch digital biodiversity register
content: A 12-member committee has been formed in all the 21 wards to complete the task and release the digitised version on October 2, says panchayat president

title: Drains along M.G. Road in Kochi to be renovated to increase carrying capacity
content: Of the 9.40-km stretch, 2.60 km from Pharmacy Junction likely to be covered in initial phase; PWD to use ₹10 cr. under Operation Breakthrough

title: Schools in Kozhikode step up security with strengthened SPG network
content: The SPGs, functioning under the heads of institutions, mainly comprise student representatives, parent-teacher association nominees, and community members from diverse sectors who can closely monitor student movements

title: Air India finds no issues with locking mechanism of fuel control switch in B787 planes: Official
content: The official also said that all the Boeing 787-8 aircraft have undergone Throttle Control Module (TCM) replacement as per the Boeing maintenance schedule

title: Fencing out the voter in Bihar’s poll roll preparation
content: The Supreme Court must intervene, once again, in the matter of the Bihar Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls and ensure that the manner of the preparation meets India’s exacting constitutional standards

title: Tiruchi Siva’s comment on Kamaraj causes unease within DMK-Congress alliance in Tamil Nadu
content: DMK Rajya Sabha MP Tiruchi Siva had remarked that former Chief Minister and Congress stalwart K. Kamaraj wouldn’t sleep without an air conditioner

title: Suvendu demands ‘thorough revision’ of voter list in Bengal
content: West Bengal goes to the polls next year, while the Assembly election is due in Bihar later this year.

title: Govt will train CSCs in AI, address duplication in State govt efforts: Vaishnaw
content: The IT Minister felicitated CSC operators in remote and rural districts, and said the government would train CSC workers in AI and address issues arising from duplication of CSC work by State government initiatives.

title: Biles, SGA, Eagles capture top honors at ESPYS
content: Olympic champion gymnast Simone Biles and NBA Finals MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander took home top athlete honors, while the Super Bowl champ Eagles won best team at Wednesday night's ESPYS.

title: Source: Vet Miller to Commanders on 1-year deal
content: The Commanders are signing veteran defensive end Von Miller, a move designed to bolster their pass rush and increase their ability to close out games on defense.

title: Miami 'outclassed' as historic Messi streak ends
content: Lionel Messi's MLS record streak of scoring two goals in a game ended at five as Inter Miami CF lost 3-0 to FC Cincinnati on Wednesday night.

title: Clark out vs. Liberty; All-Star status uncertain
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who injured her right groin late in Tuesday's win over the Sun, was ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Liberty.

title: Sources: 49ers' Collins third Round 2 pick in fold
content: The 49ers' agreement with DT Alfred Collins is worth $10.3 million over four years and includes $9M guaranteed, sources told ESPN. He becomes just the third second-round pick this year to have signed with his team (Carson Schwesinger, Jayden Higgins).

title: D-backs star Marte's home robbed during break
content: Police are investigating a burglary that is believed to have happened Tuesday night at a home owned by Diamondbacks star Ketel Marte.

title: 5-star Boozer: Duke 'overlooked,' but not for long
content: Five-star prospect and incoming Duke freshman Cameron Boozer told ESPN on Wednesday the Blue Devils have been "overlooked" this offseason following the departures of Cooper Flagg and other NBA talent.

title: Mizrachi wins first WSOP main event, $10M prize
content: Michael "The Grinder" Mizrachi took home the $10 million first prize by eliminating John Wasnock in heads-up poker to win the World Series of Poker main event Wednesday.

title: 📷 Stars shine on the ESPYS red carpet
content: The stars shined on the red carpet before heading into the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles for the 33rd annual ESPYS.

title: What to expect from Rory and Scottie, and how will Royal Portrush play?

content: The Valkyries join the Lynx and Mercury near the front of the class, while the Fever and Sky have improved marks.

title: From New Jersey to Madrid via Brazil, Atlético is next big step for USMNT's Johnny Cardoso

title: Girelli shows Norway how to be clinical as Italy reach Euro 2025 semifinal

title: Revitalized Sweden pose serious threat to England
content: Three years ago when the teams met, the score was one-sided. This Swedish team is a different proposition, though.

title: Sources: De Paul to join Miami on loan from Atleti
content: Rodrigo De Paul is set to join Inter Miami CF from Atlético Madrid on a loan deal to make the move permanent, sources have told ESPN.

title: Yamal given Messi's iconic Barça No. 10 jersey

title: Nico Williams explains 10-year Athletic extension
content: Nico Williams said he wants to continue making history at Athletic Club having turned down offers to leave the Basque outfit this summer.

title: Poland hire new coach after Lewandowski fallout
content: Jan Urban has been appointed as Poland national manager, the country's football association (PZPN) said on Wednesday, with the 63-year-old replacing Michal Probierz who resigned in June.

title: 'Proud' Italy end 28-year wait to reach semifinals
content: An ecstatic Italy coach Andrea Soncin credited past players for paving the way after clinching their first Women's Euro semifinal berth since 1997.

title: 'Great club legend' Vázquez's time in Madrid over
